posts.post_content:
Price is $450 firm.  There is a small amount of paper loss on the neck area that accounts for the grade.  Otherwise, presents as EX - no creases.  Clean back, but scans are available upon request.  PayPal ok.  

[IMG]http://i185.photobucket.com/albums/x137/vintagetoppsguy/Pre-War%20Cards/AllenGinterComiskey.jpg[/IMG]
One price bump to $425.00.  I bought this in the February, 2011 B&L Auction.  With BP and TX state sales tax, I paid a lot more than that.
AWESOME card! If I had the $$$, I'd SURELY get it!
Wish I'd have waited.  I recently picked up a PSA 2 for 600. This seems like a very fair price on this one. Great card from a great seller!

Thank you, Roger, for the kind words.  However, I just got my integrity called into question by another board member vai PM.  He wrote:

"Not saying the price isn't fair, but you are wrong about paying more than that from what I see.  The past auctions tab shows "Final Bid(Includes Buyers Premium):$389.00.  The maximum (could be lower) sales TX state tax is 8.25% so that would bring it to $421.0925.  You aren't making much profit, but it would be erroneous to say that you "paid a lot more".  When you really (at max) paid $4 less.  

I didn't want to call you out on the board since it was information that you didn't even have to share and I really do think the price is still fair (even though I can't do it)."

I won't mention names, but I will clear up his comments just in case anybody else was wondering the same thing.  

Yes, the lot closed at $389.  However, that DID NOT include the Buyers Premium of $48.63 (12.5 %).  So, $389 + $48.63 = $437.63.  If you look at VCP, it shows exactly $437.63.  Now, I paid another $36.10 in Texas state sales taxes.  That made my grand total $473.73 (not even including shipping).  At $425, I would have taken nearly a $50 loss.  

At this point, I think I'm just going to hold onto the card.  Thanks for all who looked and were interested and the kind words that were said.
